NullPointerException thrown: null


Wow!  This just started happening. Been using a few aspects on a lot of classes for weeks now without incident.

Suddenly, started getting a popup with this error.

I tried upgrading to Eclipse 3.2 and AJDT 1.4 ... same error.

Nothing remarkable about the code I was working on, either.

It has something to do with the following method:

    @SuppressNullCheck
    public List<String> findServiceIdsForInterface(Class serviceInterface, Module module)
    {
        notNull(serviceInterface, "serviceInterface");

        List<String> result = CollectionFactory.newList();

        for (String id : _moduleDef.getServiceIds())
        {
            ServiceDef def = _moduleDef.getServiceDef(id);

            if (def.getServiceInterface() != serviceInterface)
                continue;
        }

        return result;
    }


Removing the method annotation doesn't seem to help.

With the annotation in place, this method is filtered out and not targetted by an aspect I created that does runtime checking of parameters to see if they are null.

You can see a (recent version of the) source here:

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/tapestry/tapestry5/tapestry-core/trunk/src/main/java/org/apache/tapestry/internal/ioc/ModuleImpl.java?view=markup



Commenting out the method entirely returns things to normal.

I get the AJDT popup every time I save changes (forcing a recompile).


For the same source code, using the command line (and Maven 2) everything seems fine:

bash-3.1$
I've found my workaround for it, so I've downgraded it to major.

This is one of those 'crash whilst crashing' bugs.  In attempting to gather the debug to report something, we crash with an NPE and lose the original problem.
I agree with your diagnosis of the continue being the problem, I'll look at this next week.

I am trying to recreate this so I can fix it - but I'm not having much success.  Can I ask what kind of advice is applying to this method and which join points are being affected?

If I fix the NPE with a guard, will you be able to try a dev build of aspectj for me to see what the error behind the NPE actually is?

Well, you can download the entire source (including code, aspects, etc.)

Details at http://tapestry.apache.org/tapestry5/

This may be related to bug 155763. This bug produces an NPE on the same line of code, however, with a slightly different stack trace. The reason it may be related is that in order to reproduce bug 155763 you need a foreach loop which contains generics, a "continue" statement and some code before the "continue" statement. The testcase in this bug has all of those things.

Just as a note ..... bug 155763 is due to a bug in the jdt compiler which is fixed in 3.2 M5. I haven't been able to reproduce the NPE with the stack trace reported here, however, it might be related to this fix since the symptoms are the foreach and continue statements. Moreover, the jdt bug (bug 199175) mentions that commenting out the "continue" fixes the problem which this bug reports too (in comment #1).
ooops - the jdt bug is bug 119175 (not 199175)!
